description.narrative: Stöd för kapacitetsutveckling av colombiansk polis, genom den svenska Polismyndigheten. Insatsen är en fortsättning på det samarbete mellan colombiansk polis och den svenska Polismyndigheten som har pågått sedan 2013. Projektet har utvecklats i samarbete mellan de båda myndigheterna och bidrar till reformen av Colombias säkerhetssektor, med fokus på ökad medborgerlig tillit och tillgång till polisens tjänster, samt med det övergripande målet att förbereda colombiansk polis för en framtida övergång från militär till civil myndighet. Genom insatsen har svensk polis en rådgivande funktion till sin colombianska motsvarighet, inom områdena polisutbildning, brottsförebyggande arbete och jämställdhet. Ingen vidareförmedling av medel sker till colombiansk polis inom ramarna för denna insats.

Support for capacity development of Colombian police, through the Swedish Police Authority. The contribution is a continuation of the cooperation between the Colombian police and the Swedish Police Authority that has been ongoing since 2013. The project has been developed in cooperation between the two authorities and contributes to the reform of Colombia's security sector, focusing on increased civic trust and access to police services, with the overall aim of preparing Colombian police for a future transition from a military to civilian authority. Through the contribution, the Swedish police have an advisory function to their Colombian counterpart, in the areas of police training, crime prevention and gender equality. No forwarding of funds to colombian police takes place within the framework of this contribution.

Support provided by the Swedish Police Authority for capacity development of Colombian National Police. The contribution is a continuation of the cooperation between the Colombian police and the Swedish Police Authority that has been ongoing since 2013. The project has been developed by the two police authorities and contributes to the efforts to make police-services more modern, efficient and accessible to the average citizen, with the overall goal of preparing the Colombian police for a future transition from a military to civilian authority, in the context of a stable and sustainable peace. Through the contribution, the Swedish police have an advisory function to their Colombian counterpart, in the areas of police-education, crime-prevention and internal gender equality. No forwarding of funds to Colombian police takes place within the framework of this contribution.

description.narrative:
Many project activities were cancelled or postponed during 2020 due to the pandemic,and progress towards results has therefore been slower than anticipated. The activityperiod was set to end in December 2020 but has consequently been extended to 2022,with existing funds. None the less, there is already significant progress in several areas:
In the Police-education component support from the Swedish Police Authority (SPA)has resulted in the creation of a new model for management of teachers and teachings within the Colombian National Police, adapting and modernizing the content of trainings as well as the competencies and methods of teachers and trainers. The model introduces a clear profile for police teachers, including knowledge in pedagogical methods and the capacity to coordinate academic programmes. It also includes provisions regarding competence development and selection procedures for teachers. Regarding the content of trainings, several new subjects have been introduced as a result of the project. For instance, Crime-prevention is now a mandatory subject in the basic Colombian police-training, as well as in the courses for promotion and continuous competence-development.
This new model builds on the experiences and lessons learned from activities carried out by the SPA during previous years, including teacher-trainings, reference-visits to Sweden and pilot-projects carried out and evaluated at Colombian training centres. The model is thus developed by the Colombian police, with support of the SPA, which ensures local ownership and relevance in the specific circumstances of Colombian law-enforcement. The model is expected to be formally approved and rolled out by the Colombian police authority in 2021. The support by the SPA in the Prevention and Criminology component focuses on demonstrating the benefits of preventive police-work (in addition to and in combination with traditional reactive or responsive police-work) and on developing methods that allow the Colombian police to adopt and evaluate a preventive approach to law-enforcement, through pilot-projects carried out at several locations around the country. The work in the pilot areas was interrupted during 2020 due to the pandemic but, even so, the Colombian police decided to strengthen its preventive approach and launched neighborhood-police project, with 1440 police officers in 8 cities, based on the positive experiences from the SPAs support in previous years.
Efforts were also made to improve the educational part of crime-prevention, resulting in the inclusion of Crime-prevention as a mandatory subject, as mentioned above, and in the strengthening of the relevance of the educational content of this course. The gender equality component of the project was introduced later and has therefore not come as far as the first two components. Progress was made in the development of an internal policy for gender equality within the Colombian police-force, but the document is still not finished. Important steps were taken however, through the creation of a Gender-equality working group that centralizes the (previously decentralized)coordination of gender equality within the PNC, and re-confirmation that the document will indeed be an internal policy (as opposed to a lower-ranking and thus less important directive or action-plan), thereby also sending a clear message to all policemen and women that gender equality is an important priority of highest leadership within the Colombian Policy authority.
